reference_a:
@article{bosley2020,
  title = {Idiographic dynamics of positive affect in {{GAD}}},
  author = {Bosley, Hannah G. and Sandel, Devon B. and Fisher, Aaron J.},
  date = {2020-05},
  journaltitle = {European Journal of Psychological Assessment},
  volume = {36},
  number = {3},
  pages = {500--509},
  publisher = {Hogrefe Publishing},
  issn = {1015-5759},
  doi = {10.1027/1015-5759/a000580}
}
participants: undergraduate students with elevated GAD symptoms
additional_comments: item order was randomized; wording of items not fully clear but inferred from article+data; no beep information available; number of max. time points and days taken as maximum of observations in data

features.name: bragging_thought
features.coding: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think "People will think I'm bragging"?
features.details: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think "People will think I'm bragging"?
features.source: The Response to Positive Affect Scale (RPA; Feldman, Joorman, and Johnson, 2008), dampening subscale

features.name: too_good_to_be_true
features.coding: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think this is too good to be true?
features.details: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think this is too good to be true?
features.source: The Response to Positive Affect Scale (RPA; Feldman, Joorman, and Johnson, 2008), dampening subscale

features.name: ruminate_negatives
features.coding: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you things that have not gone well?
features.details: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you things that have not gone well?
features.source: The Response to Positive Affect Scale (RPA; Feldman, Joorman, and Johnson, 2008), dampening subscale

features.name: feelings_transient
features.coding: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you remind yourself that these feelings won't last?
features.details: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you remind yourself that these feelings won't last?
features.source: The Response to Positive Affect Scale (RPA; Feldman, Joorman, and Johnson, 2008), dampening subscale

features.name: hard_to_concentrate
features.coding: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think about how hard it is to concentrate?
features.details: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think about how hard it is to concentrate?
features.source: The Response to Positive Affect Scale (RPA; Feldman, Joorman, and Johnson, 2008), dampening subscale
features.construct: cognitive dampening, concentration, dampening, emotion regulation

features.name: think_of_risks
features.coding: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think about things that could go wrong?
features.details: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think about things that could go wrong?
features.source: The Response to Positive Affect Scale (RPA; Feldman, Joorman, and Johnson, 2008), dampening subscale
features.construct: catastrophic thinking, worry, dampening, emotion regulation

features.name: undeserving
features.coding: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think "I don't deserve this"?
features.details: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think "I don't deserve this"?
features.source: The Response to Positive Affect Scale (RPA; Feldman, Joorman, and Johnson, 2008), dampening subscale

features.name: luck_will_end
features.coding: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think "My streak of luck is going to end soon"?
features.details: Since the last survey, when you felt happy, how often did you think "My streak of luck is going to end soon"?
features.source: The Response to Positive Affect Scale (RPA; Feldman, Joorman, and Johnson, 2008), dampening subscale

features.name: happy
features.source: neutral arousal exemplar of positive affect

features.name: content
features.source: low arousal exemplar of positive affect

features.name: excited
features.source: high arousal exemplar of positive affect
features.construct: excitement, positive affect, affect, extraversion, big five

features.name: depressed
features.construct: depression, negative affect, affect, neuroticism, big five, psychopathology

features.name: nervous
features.construct: nervousness, negative affect, affect, neuroticism, big five

features.name: alert
features.construct: alertness, positive affect, affect, etxraversion, big five

features.name: active
features.construct: active, energy, positive affect, affect, big five, extraversion

features.name: afraid
features.construct: fear, negative affect, affect, neuroticism, big five

features.name: upset
features.construct: upset, negative affect, affect, neuroticism, big five

features.name: worry_frequent
features.construct: worry, anxiety, psychopathology, negative affect, affect, neuroticism, big five

features.name: worry_hard_to_control
features.coding: Felt that worry is difficult to stop or control
features.details: Felt that worry is difficult to stop or control
features.construct: worry, anxiety, psychopathology, negative affect, affect, neuroticism, big five

features.name: worry_interferes
features.coding: Felt that worry is interfering with your life
features.details: Felt that worry is interfering with your life
features.construct: worry, anxiety, psychopathology, negative affect, affect, neuroticism, big five
